forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. West northwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the city is wrapped in a veil of coolness and gentle gray cloud cover. Though the sun made its struggle to shine through earlier in the day, its valiant attempts have given way to a distinct chance of showers later tonight, with the air humming with a light tension from the wind gusts threading through the streets. The temperature has settled around a brisk 46 degrees, inviting a contemplative mood. For those wandering the iconic streets, it’s advised to don layers; a light jacket or sweater will serve well against the occasional chill, especially with gusts reaching 21 mph.

Although the sky remains mostly cloudy, there is a certain beauty in this twilight, the city lights flickering gently to life against the backdrop of the muted heavens. The likelihood of rain in the air conjures a delicate anticipation for those who might stroll along the Embarcadero or find solace in one of the cozier cafes, perhaps indulging in a warm cup of tea or coffee while watching the world hustle by. This evening offers a chance to savor the rhythms of the city, embracing its quiet charm in a moment where the mundane turns poetic, as raindrops dance silently on the window panes.
